folder: Pitt Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
Hamilton Fish Park: A northeastern view across same to East Houston (left) and Sheriff (right) Streets. This open play area is equally divided by Willet Street which appears in the center, running from right to left. Today (1937) the northern half (immediate foreground) has been improved with a large swimming pool which was constructed by the W.P.A. under the auspices of Park Commissioner Moses.

About 1922.

Ewing Galloway.

folder: Houston Street (East) & Avenue C, Manhattan, NY
text:
364-370 E. Houston Street, adjoining and east of the S.W. corner of Avenue C. No. 366 is a frame house with a brick front. The 5 story tenement at the right margin is No. 370. The three low buildings, No's. 364 to 368 inclusive, between the corner structure (left, not seen) and this, are to be razed according to the New York Sun of February 23, 1939. View No. 2 shows the lower portions of No's 364 and 366.

1932
View 2: January 17, 1928

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York : View 1

P. L. Sperr : View 2

folder: Houston Street (East) & Pitt Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
384 (empty lot), 388-392, and 394-396 East Houston Street, north side, between Pitt and Sheriff Streets, showing the Hamilton Fish Park branch of the New York Public Library (No. 388-392) and the Down Town Talmud Torah, a Hebrew school (No. 394-396).

January 17, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
